snippet: The state-run China Poly Group Corporation, once part of the army, has grown from an arms merchant to a conglomerate behind the world’s third-largest auction house.
abstract: Beijing Poly International Auction, state-run conglomerate that has become world's third-largest auction house, is fighting efforts to reform China's art market, which is rife with fraud, forgeries and payment defaults; house is using its expansive business interests and governmental influence to shield it from encroaching regulations (Series: A Culture of Bidding).

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and DAVID BARBOZA
byline.contributor: Amanda Cox contributed research from New York and Shi Da from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The state-run China Poly Group Corporation, once part of the army, has grown from an arms merchant to a conglomerate behind the world’s third-largest auction house.

headline.seo: China Poly Group Corp. Takes On Christie’s and Sotheby’s
headline.main: China’s Art Market Powerhouse Complicates Reform Efforts
headline.print_headline: China’s Art Market Powerhouse Complicates Reform Efforts
